results.title: Care of art materials
results.brief_description: This film will be useful in primary classes in art education, but it will also be useful to any one using art materials. Its primary purpose is to promote greater care and interest in the use of the art tools commonly found in the school class-room in grades 1 to 4.

results.title: Care and maintenance of building plant
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Basic Films and John Rhodes
results.brief_description: The film emphasises the necessity for conserving resources by maintaining plant at a high level of efficiency. Examples of neglect and some of the major repair work required because of the neglect of day-to-day maintenance are shown. The need for operators to realise their responsibility for keeping a machine in order is stressed. While every machine has its own maintenance routine, the simple rules common to all machines are demonstrated.

results.title: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation
results.brief_description: A refresher course for people with First Aid training on cardiopulmonary resuscitation. An excellent resource for Occupational Health and Safety Officers which demonstrates in clear and concise steps, the correct procedures for cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an adult. There is a simulated workplace accident which highlights the importance of following correct procedures. Many of the techniques are demonstrated by the use of a resuscitation dummy.

results.title: Carcassonne: a French fortress = Carcassonne, fortifications francaises
results.creator_credit: Ernest Kleinberg, Ernest Kleinberg Films and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A French language teaching film. Presents a visual tour through Carcassonne, the finest example of a fortified medieval city. Shows how the past influences the lives of the townspeople and includes scenes of shops, schools and farms as well as a brief sequence of a French family. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Carcase constructions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Using a knife box as an example, this film describes how boards can be joined at the corners. No other credits available.

results.title: Carburetor: principles of operation
results.brief_description: This film explains the major components of the carburetor - bore, bowl and air throttle. Also explains air pressure differential, metering, atomization and vaporization. Shows designs and devices used in carburetors.

results.title: Carbon fourteen
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the use of radioactive carbon as a means of determining the age of historic and prehistoric objects; shows how carbon fourteen is being used in studying the process of photosynthesis; and describes experiments at the Argonne National Laboratory, near Chicago, which are being conducted to study the effect of atomic radiation on plant growth.

results.title: Carbon content
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Robin Cantelon and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
In steel, carbon exists as a chemical compound with iron, known as cementite. The distribution of cementite and ferrite, or pure iron, governs grain structure. The film shows how this distribution is affected when the steel is heated and cooled

results.title: Carbon-dioxide absorption technique
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of CO2, absorption techniques, and demonstrates two methods in use: Single-phase absorption and closed circuit or double-phase absorption.

results.title: Carbon
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison Associates and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: Shows the various forms of carbon and the familiar uses of such substances as diamond, pencil lead and charcoal. Surveys the everyday uses of carbon, both in the house and in industry, and touches on the development of pyrographite and carbon fibres. Suitable for secondary school level.
